instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: a1466 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
green/orange light

psu current is too low .049amp
some corroded around  y1915 resistors has been replaced
and c1271 removed PP1V05_S0_PCH_VCCACLKPLL
also corroded on u1930 pin 6 cleaned and replaced.
cannot smc bypass

ppbus 8.59v
pp3v42 ok
pp3v3 s5 ok
SMC_PM_G2_EN ok
pm batlow l ok
PPVRTC_G3H ok


missing voltages:
ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0v  u8150 removed
pp3v3 sus .9v
pm so good 0v
syspwr ok r 0v
all not shorted.

threads.title: a1466 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
You probably miss PM_SLP_SUS_L, which point to PCH, or some of its previous signals.
Check PM_DSW_PWRGD, PCH_DSWVRMEN and all PCH's RTC signals.

threads.title: a1466 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
PM_SLP_SUS_L 3.3v
PM_DSW_PWRGD 3.4v
PCH_DSWVRMEN 3.2v

pch rtc signal
RTC_RESET_L 3.3v
PCH_SRTCRST_L 3.3v
PCH_INTRUDER_L 3v
PCH_INTVRMEN 3.1v

threads.title: a1466 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
"PM_SLP_SUS_L 3.3v"
Ooops, 3V3_SUS is already enabled; no need to check the other mentioned signals.
Post U8020 voltages.
Also check diode mode to ground at R8020.

threads.title: a1466 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
U/R8020 voltages are normal but 
from c1202/U6100/u6101/ U/R8183 U/R7840 3v3_sus is only .9v
i tried jumper from r8020 pin2 to c1202 pin 1 now 
all c1202/U6100/u6101/ U/R8183 U/R7840 3v3_sus is 3.3v but still
cant on psu amp is jump from .350amp then drops again to .49amp

threads.title: a1466 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
Probably more corroded traces.

Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L (at same time).

threads.title: a1466 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
PM_PWRBTN_L yes it has a drop pulse
from 3.4v to .3v

threads.title: a1466 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
Check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4_l, at same time.
Be sure PM_RSMRST_L is steady high.

threads.title: a1466 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
PM_SLP_S4_l from 0v whentrigered pulse to 3.2v
PM_RSMRST_L 3v steady

threads.title: a1466 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
So PCH starts the power on sequence.
Check the same for PM_SLP_S3_L.
S3 and S0 voltages should also pulse; confirm that.

threads.title: a1466 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
PM_SLP_S3_L same  from 0v whentrigered pulse to 3.2v 
 PM_SLP_S0_L same  from 0v whentrigered pulse to 3.2v

threads.title: a1466 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
"S3 and S0 voltages should also pulse; confirm that."

You should also get pulse on ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
